initial_step.instruction: Confirm that you are working ONLY with the final target image provided for analysis. Disregard all previous example images.

phase_1_text_identification.step: Scan ONLY within the target image for potential handwritten text regions.
If no potential handwriting is found, immediately skip to the final_verification step.
Mark all potential handwritten text areas and keep it in your mind.
Distinguish handwritten from printed text, stamps, or mechanical marks.
Identify different handwriting styles or writers if multiple are present.

morphological_criteria.criterion: Stroke direction analysis: Identify pen movement patterns and directional flow.
Pressure variation: Detect thick/thin line variations indicating pen angle and speed.
Connection patterns: Analyze how characters connect within words and letter formations.
Proportional relationships: Measure ascender/descender heights relative to x-height.
Character formation: Identify individual letter construction patterns and allographs.

analysis_steps.step: Examine stroke formation patterns for each potential character.
Identify consistent writing characteristics across the document.
Note variations that may indicate multiple writers or different writing implements.
Document uncertain characters requiring further analysis.

comparison_criteria.criterion: Collect multiple instances of each character throughout the document.
Create pattern templates from repeated character formations.
Identify consistent allographic variations used by the writer.
Use statistical patterns to resolve ambiguous character instances.
Cross-reference character forms with known paleographic standards if historical.

validation_steps.step: Build character exemplar database from clear instances in the document.
Compare uncertain characters against established patterns.
Identify outliers that may indicate errors or special cases.
Validate character identification consistency throughout the text.

contextual_criteria.criterion: Linguistic probability: Apply letter frequency data for the relevant language/period.
Orthographic patterns: Consider historical spelling conventions and abbreviations.
Semantic coherence: Verify that character choices create meaningful words.
Syntactic structure: Ensure transcription follows period-appropriate grammar.
Document context: Consider the type and purpose of the document being analyzed.

contextual_steps.step: Apply linguistic knowledge to resolve remaining character ambiguities.
Verify word formations make sense within document context.
Check for consistent spelling patterns and abbreviation usage.
Validate sentence structure and meaning coherence.

physical_criteria.criterion: Ink flow patterns: Track how ink pools or spreads at letter junctions.
Paper interaction: Note how writing instrument interacts with paper texture.
Correction analysis: Identify overwriting, erasures, or amendments.
Bleed-through evidence: Use reverse-side impressions to clarify ambiguous strokes.
Writing implement characteristics: Assess pen/pencil type and condition effects.

evidence_steps.step: Examine ink behavior and flow patterns for character clarification.
Analyze paper-ink interaction effects on character formation.
Identify and document any corrections or editorial marks.
Use physical evidence to support or refute character identifications.

confidence_levels.level: HIGH: Clear character formation with multiple supporting evidence types.
MEDIUM: Good character formation with minor ambiguity resolved by context.
LOW: Recognizable character pattern but requires contextual or comparative support.
UNCERTAIN: Character present but multiple interpretations possible - mark with [?].
ILLEGIBLE: Clear handwriting present but completely unreadable - mark with [...].

scoring_steps.step: Assign confidence levels to each transcribed character or word.
Provide alternative readings for uncertain elements when possible.
Mark illegible sections appropriately without forced interpretation.

final_verification.step: Review each transcribed element against all verification criteria.
Ensure no information has been included from example images.
Verify confidence scores accurately reflect transcription certainty.
Confirm transcription preserves original document structure and meaning.
Validate that only genuine handwriting has been transcribed (no printed text).
Check that uncertain elements are appropriately marked with confidence indicators.
